main event: On 2nd February 1951, a UFO sighting was reported at Dobbin Air Force Base in Marietta, Georgia. The object was observed hovering at an altitude between 1000 and 2000 feet, then moved slowly before disappearing at a high rate of speed.
interesting points: Efforts to make radar pick-up of the object were unsuccessful, indicating maneuvering at a precision and speed exceeding that of any known aircraft in the area.
Witnesses observed the object moving slowly before quickly disappearing, with its maneuvering tracked by eye rather than radar.
The object was reported to leave a green, blue, and white light as it vanished, suggesting unusual characteristics.
The sighting occurred with twelve miles of visibility and was observed by multiple individuals, adding credibility to the report.
The report was forwarded according to the protocols for reporting unidentified aerial objects, indicating the seriousness with which it was treated.
witnesses: multiple individuals at Dobbin Air Force Base
